headline: Opinion: Billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller, After Dropping This AI Giant Last Year, Could Be Coming Back to It During the Nasdaq Correction

Billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller has a long track record of success, delivering an average annual return of 30% over 30 years at Duquesne Capital Management without any money-losing years.  Druckenmiller has likely noticed the significant drop in this player's price in recent weeks.

headline: Here's How Nvidia's Incredible AI Success Could Lead to Its Undoing
summary: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) was able to ride the artificial intelligence (AI) wave kicked off by ChatGPT in late 2022 and dominate the market for AI accelerators, partly because the company had spent years building a strong foundation in accelerated computing.  Nvidia's GPUs are useful not only for AI workloads, but also across academia and industry for running simulations and doing other computing-intensive tasks.  CUDA, Nvidia's proprietary software toolkit that allows developers to harness the power of the company's GPUs, has been around for nearly two decades.

CUDA, Nvidia's proprietary software toolkit that allows developers to harness the power of the company's GPUs, has been around for nearly two decades.

headline: 3 Struggling Stocks Down More Than 50% This Year That Look Cheap But Come With Plenty of Risk
summary: The stock market is in a bit of a tailspin of late as investors worry about the future of the economy.  Three stocks that are down big this year but that investors should think twice about buying right now are SoundHound AI (NASDAQ: SOUN), Maravai LifeSciences (NASDAQ: MRVI), and Victoria's Secret (NYSE: VSCO).  Voice artificial intelligence (AI) company SoundHound went from being a hot stock in 2024 to now being in a freefall.

headline: NASDAQ Correction: 2 AI Stocks That Aren't Worth Buying on the Dip
summary: Two stocks that I'm still not buying even after the sell-off are Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR).  Apple is one of the most recognizable consumer brands in the world and built a strong ecosystem around its iPhones.  Although Apple's revenue is trending in the right direction, it's only projected to grow revenue by a mere 4.6% in fiscal year 2025 (ending around September 30).

headline: Chip war: Chinese start-up aims to break Nvidia's grip on AI with new model framework
summary: A new artificial intelligence (AI) framework developed by teams associated with China's Tsinghua University is said to be able to reduce reliance on Nvidia chips for AI model inference, marking the latest effort by the country to enhance technological self-sufficiency. Chitu, a high-performance inference framework for large language models (LLMs), can operate on chips made in China, challenging the dominance of Nvidia's Hopper series graphics processing units (GPUs) in supporting certain models,

headline: 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks With 41% or More Upside, According to Wall Street Analysts
summary: The potential for artificial intelligence (AI) to improve the fortunes of leading businesses has been a huge catalyst for the stock market over the last few years.  The following stocks of leading chip companies could offer upside of 39% to 48% based on the average analyst price target.  Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) has played runner-up to Nvidia in the graphics processing unit (GPU) market for many years.
